titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Kotaro Suto Papers LSC.0483
titlestmt.subtitle: Japanese American Research Project (JARP) Collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Manuscripts Division staff, November 1997; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé; supplementary encoding and revision by Caroline Cubé.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-24 14:19:11 -0700.

did.abstract: Kōtarō Sutō (ca. 1883- ) worked for Miami pioneer developer, Carl Fisher, before starting his own nursery business. This collection contains clippings about the Sutōs (mostly from Miami sources), photographs and snapshots of the Sutōs, records and correspondence related to Sutō's nursery, and correspondence and other records related to the Sutō's donations to various charitable organizations. It also includes clippings on Carl G. Fisher. Materials in this collection are primarily in English, with some in Japanese.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and Japanese.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Kotaro Suto Papers (Collection 483). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Funding: This online finding aid has been funded in part by a grant from the Library Services and Technology Act (LSTA).

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Kōtarō Sutō was born ca. 1883; a native of Kanagawa Prefecture, he came to the United States in 1900 and relocated to Miami Beach, Florida, ca. 1916; married Masa Sutō, 1921; worked for Miami pioneer developer, Carl Fisher, before starting his own nursery business; was given many commendations and honors for his active participation in and devotion to the city of Miami; Kōtarō and Masa, known as Papa and Mama, became United States citizens (1958); Kōtarō died in 1963.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of two scrapbooks of newspaper clippings, photographs, and letters related to Kōtarō Sutō and his wife Masa Sutō.
Most of the collection is in English with portions in Japanese.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Correspondence and newspaper clippings (Box 141).
Business records and correspondence, photographs, and miscellany (Box 142).
Oversize photographs (Box 723).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional material related to Kōtarō Sutō is found in Boxes 141-142 and 723 of the Japanese American Research Project - Fading Footsteps of the Issei (Collection 2010). Available at UCLA Library Special Collections.
